_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_ | _üü† Major_
items.body:
_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_ | _üü† Major_ **Use semantic color tokens instead of direct colors.** Lines 75 and 76 use direct Tailwind colors (`text-emerald-600`, `text-emerald-700`) instead of semantic tokens. Per coding guidelines: "Always use semantic color tokens (bg-background, text-foreground, border-border) instead of direct colors (bg-white, text-black, border-gray-300)." Consider using semantic tokens like `text-success` or defining a success color token in your design system. As per coding guidelines.
üîé Proposed fix ```diff
- - + + {stockDisplay} {stockUnit}
``` Note: Ensure `text-success` is defined in your Tailwind configuration as a semantic token.
> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.
ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents ``` In src/components/prep/PrepRecipeCard.tsx around lines 72 to 82, the stock color classes use direct Tailwind colors (text-emerald-600 and text-emerald-700); replace those with your design-system semantic color tokens (for example text-success and a matching foreground token such as text-success-foreground or font-medium text-success-foreground) so styling follows the semantic token convention, and ensure the referenced semantic token(s) are defined in the Tailwind config; update the className strings accordingly (keeping other classes like font-medium) and run a quick build/check to confirm the tokens exist. ```

**Avoid `any` type - use proper TypeScript type.**

The `restaurant` parameter is typed as `any`. Per coding guidelines, "Use TypeScript types everywhere - no `any` type unless justified with a comment." 

Use the proper restaurant type from your context or define an interface for it.



<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
-  const handleRestaurantSelect = (restaurant: any) => {
+  const handleRestaurantSelect = (restaurant: { restaurant_id: string; restaurant?: { name: string } } | null) => {
     setSelectedRestaurant(restaurant);
   };
```
</details>


> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.

setSelectedRestaurant state typing accordingly so the function signature becomes

props that use it are typed to Restaurant to keep types consistent across the

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

**Ambiguous treatment of 'oz' in volume context.**

Line 112 treats plain `'oz'` as fluid ounces (`* 29.5735`), but per coding guidelines, `'oz'` should represent weight ounces while `'fl oz'` represents fluid ounces. This can cause incorrect inventory calculations when a recipe uses weight ounces but the container is volume-based.

Consider removing `'oz'` from the volume conversion branch and only handling `'fl oz'` for volume contexts.


<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
-        IF v_size_unit_lower IN ('gal','l','ml','qt','pint','cup') AND v_recipe_unit_lower IN ('fl oz','oz','ml','l','cup','tbsp','tsp','gal','qt','pint') THEN
+        IF v_size_unit_lower IN ('gal','l','ml','qt','pint','cup','fl oz') AND v_recipe_unit_lower IN ('fl oz','ml','l','cup','tbsp','tsp','gal','qt','pint') THEN
           v_recipe_in_ml := CASE v_recipe_unit_lower
             WHEN 'fl oz' THEN v_actual * 29.5735
-            WHEN 'oz' THEN v_actual * 29.5735
             WHEN 'ml' THEN v_actual
```
</details>

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_

**Test fails: function raises error instead of returning input quantity.**

Per the pipeline failure logs, `calculate_inventory_impact_for_product` raises "Not authorized for this restaurant" for an invalid restaurant_id rather than returning the input quantity. The test expectation doesn't match the actual function behavior.

Either update the test to expect the exception, or wrap the call in an exception handler:


<details>
<summary>üîé Option 1: Test for exception using pgTAP throws_ok</summary>

```diff
 -- Test 21: Invalid restaurant_id should return input quantity
-SELECT is(
-  calculate_inventory_impact_for_product(
-    'a0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001'::uuid,
-    1.0,
-    'cup',
-    '99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999'::uuid
-  ),
-  1.0,
-  'Invalid restaurant_id should return input quantity'
+SELECT throws_ok(
+  $$SELECT calculate_inventory_impact_for_product(
+    'a0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001'::uuid,
+    1.0,
+    'cup',
+    '99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999'::uuid
+  )$$,
+  'P0001',
+  'Not authorized for this restaurant',
+  'Invalid restaurant_id should raise authorization error'
 );
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>üîé Option 2: Modify function to return input quantity instead of raising</summary>

If the desired behavior is to gracefully return input quantity for unauthorized access, the SQL function needs to catch the exception and return `p_recipe_quantity` instead of raising.
</details>

<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
-- Test 21: Invalid restaurant_id should return input quantity
SELECT throws_ok(
  $$SELECT calculate_inventory_impact_for_product(
    'a0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001'::uuid,
    1.0,
    'cup',
    '99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999'::uuid
  )$$,
  'P0001',
  'Not authorized for this restaurant',
  'Invalid restaurant_id should raise authorization error'
);
```

</details>

<!-- suggestion_end -->

<details>
<summary>üß∞ Tools</summary>

<details>
<summary>ü™õ GitHub Actions: Unit Tests</summary>

[error] 265-265: SQL error during test: Not authorized for this restaurant. Context: RAISE in calculate_inventory_impact_for_product(line 24) while executing 14_calculate_inventory_impact_conversions.sql.

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

**Test calls non-existent `completeProductionRun` method.**

The actual `useProductionRuns` hook exposes `saveRunActuals` for completing production runs, not `completeProductionRun`. This test validates behavior of a mocked method that doesn't exist in the real implementation.


<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix to use actual method name</summary>

```diff
-    it('should complete a production run', async () => {
-      const completeProductionRunMock = vi.fn().mockResolvedValue({
+    it('should save run actuals and complete a production run', async () => {
+      const saveRunActualsMock = vi.fn().mockResolvedValue({
         ...mockProductionRun,
         status: 'completed',
         actual_yield: 18,
       });
       const mockUseProductionRuns = vi.mocked(useProductionRuns);
       mockUseProductionRuns.mockReturnValue({
-        productionRuns: [mockProductionRun],
+        runs: [mockProductionRun],
         loading: false,
-        error: null,
         createProductionRun: vi.fn(),
-        updateProductionRun: vi.fn(),
-        completeProductionRun: completeProductionRunMock,
+        updateRunStatus: vi.fn(),
+        saveRunActuals: saveRunActualsMock,
+        fetchRuns: vi.fn(),
+        statusCounts: {},
       });
```
</details>


> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In tests/unit/prepProductionHooks.test.tsx around lines 257 to 294, the test
mocks and calls a non-existent completeProductionRun method; replace it with the
real hook method saveRunActuals: create a vi.fn() mock named saveRunActuals
(returning the completed run), include saveRunActuals in the mockReturnValue
object instead of completeProductionRun, call
result.current.saveRunActuals('run-1', {...}) in the test, and update the
expectation to expect(saveRunActuals).toHaveBeenCalledWith('run-1', {...}) so
the test matches the real hook API.
```

</details>

+        deleteProduct: vi.fn(),

```

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

**Add missing normalization mappings for volume unit variations.**

Line 9 extends `volumeUnits` with variations ('l', 'gallon', 'quart', 'pint', 'floz') that `getUnitCategory` will recognize, but `normalizeUnitName` lacks mappings to convert them to canonical forms. For example, 'gallon' is recognized as a volume unit but won't normalize to 'gal' (the canonical form in `VOLUME_UNITS`).



<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix: add missing normalization mappings</summary>

```diff
 export function normalizeUnitName(unit: string): string {
   const mapping: Record<string, string> = {
     // Volume
     'ounce': 'oz',
     'fluid ounce': 'fl oz',
     'fl oz': 'fl oz',
     'fluid oz': 'fl oz',
+    'floz': 'fl oz',
     'milliliter': 'ml',
     'millilitre': 'ml',
+    'l': 'L',
+    'liter': 'L',
+    'litre': 'L',
+    'gallon': 'gal',
+    'gallons': 'gal',
+    'quart': 'qt',
+    'quarts': 'qt',
+    'pint': 'pt',
+    'pints': 'pt',
     'cups': 'cup',
```

</details>


Also applies to: 27-70

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In src/lib/unitConversion.ts around lines 9 and 27-70, add normalization
mappings for the volume unit variations that were appended to volumeUnits (for
example 'l', 'gallon', 'quart', 'pint', 'floz', 'tablespoon', 'teaspoon', 'fluid
ounce'). Update normalizeUnitName to map each of these variants to the canonical
keys used in VOLUME_UNITS (e.g., 'gallon' -> 'gal', 'quart' -> 'qt', 'pint' ->
'pt', 'floz'/'fluid ounce' -> the canonical 'fl oz' or project-specific key,
'tablespoon' -> 'tbsp', 'teaspoon' -> 'tsp', and normalize 'l' to the library's
canonical liter key), ensuring the same mappings are added/covered throughout
the function block spanning lines 27-70 so getUnitCategory results and
downstream logic use the canonical forms.
```

</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:poseidon:puma -->

items.title: <!-- This is an auto-generated comment: summarize by coderabbit.ai -->
items.body:
üìù Walkthrough ## Walkthrough Adds a prep/production feature: schema and RLS for prep recipes, ingredients, production runs and run ingredients; introduces frontend pages, dialogs, hooks, components, and RPCs to create/complete runs with unit-aware inventory deductions and cost snapshots; includes conversion refactors, tests (unit, SQL, e2e), and docs. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Documentation**
`docs/PREP_RECIPES.md` | New end-to-end user journey doc describing prep recipes, production runs/phases, UI layouts, accounting boundaries, and failure/recovery paths. | | **Routing & Sidebar**
`src/App.tsx`, `src/components/AppSidebar.tsx` | Adds `/prep-recipes` and `/batches` routes and corresponding sidebar entries. | | **Prep Recipes UI**
`src/pages/PrepRecipes.tsx`, `src/components/prep/PrepRecipeCard.tsx`, `src/components/prep/PrepRecipeDialog.tsx` | New page and components for listing, creating, editing prep recipes, ingredient rows, and recipe stats. | | **Production Runs UI**
`src/pages/Batches.tsx`, `src/components/prep/NewProductionRunDialog.tsx`, `src/components/prep/ProductionRunCard.tsx`, `src/components/prep/ProductionRunDetailDialog.tsx` | New page, dialogs and cards for creating runs, viewing runs, editing actuals, status transitions, cost and variance panels, and completion workflow. | | **Frontend Hooks**
`src/hooks/usePrepRecipes.tsx`, `src/hooks/useProductionRuns.tsx` | New hooks exposing CRUD and lifecycle operations for prep recipes and production runs, including cost calculations, output-product linking, and calls to complete-run RPCs. | | **Unit / Conversion Utilities**
`src/lib/recipeUnits.ts`, `src/lib/unitConversion.ts`, `src/hooks/useUnitConversion.tsx` | Reorganized measurement units, added validators (`isValidIngredientUnit`, `toIngredientUnit`), normalized volume unit to `fl oz`/`fluid ounce`, updated conversion maps and category logic. | | **Product / Recipe Dialogs**
`src/components/ProductDialog.tsx`, `src/components/RecipeDialog.tsx` | ProductDialog now uses generalized convertUnits and surfaces a conversionSuggestion; RecipeDialog removes useUnitConversion dependency. | | **Inventory Transactions Shape**
`src/services/inventoryTransactions.service.ts`, `supabase/functions/_shared/inventoryTransactions.ts` | Removed `individual_unit` from product selection in inventory transaction queries (changes returned product shape). | | **DB Schema & Migrations**
`supabase/migrations/20251229120000_create_prep_production_tables.sql` | New enum and tables: prep_recipes, prep_recipe_ingredients, production_runs, production_run_ingredients; indexes, triggers, RLS policies. | | **Production RPCs (complete run)**
`supabase/migrations/20251229123000_complete_production_runs.sql`, `supabase/migrations/20251229130000_refactor_complete_production_runs.sql` | Adds/rewrites `complete_production_run` and adds `calculate_inventory_impact_for_product` to centralize conversions (unit/container/density), apply inventory deductions, log transactions, and snapshot costs. | | **Cost Snapshot Columns**
`supabase/migrations/20251229124500_update_production_run_costs.sql` | Adds `unit_cost_snapshot` and `total_cost_snapshot` columns to production_run_ingredients. | | **SQL Tests**
`supabase/tests/*_prep_production_runs.sql`, `..._conversion_helper.sql`, `..._calculate_inventory_impact_conversions.sql`, `..._production_run_costing.sql`, `...refactor_complete_production_runs.sql` | New pgTAP-style tests validating conversion logic, inventory impact calculations, and complete_production_run behavior. | | **Client Tests**
`tests/e2e/prep-production.spec.ts`, `tests/unit/prepProductionHooks.test.tsx`, `tests/unit/prepProductionLogic.test.ts`, `tests/unit/unitConversion.test.ts` | E2E and unit tests covering product/recipe creation, batch lifecycle, conversion utilities, costing, variance, and hook flows. | | **Minor**
`src/pages/Inventory.tsx` | Whitespace-only edit in a memoized filter. | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram actor Kitchen as Kitchen Staff participant UI as Browser UI participant Hooks as Frontend hooks participant RPC as Supabase RPC (complete_production_run) participant DB as Supabase DB participant Inv as Inventory / inventory_transactions Kitchen->>UI: Create production run (recipe + target yield) UI->>Hooks: createProductionRun(input) Hooks->>DB: INSERT production_runs + ingredients DB-->>Hooks: returns run (status: planned) Hooks-->>UI: show run in Planned tab Kitchen->>UI: Enter actuals ‚Üí Click "Complete Batch" UI->>Hooks: saveRunActuals(payload) Hooks->>RPC: call complete_production_run(runId, actual_yield, ingredients) rect rgba(200,220,255,0.9) RPC->>DB: For each ingredient: calculate inventory impact (unit/container/density) RPC->>DB: Update product current_stock (deduct) RPC->>DB: Insert inventory_transactions (OUT) RPC->>DB: Update production_run_ingredients with cost snapshots RPC->>DB: If output product: increment stock and log IN transaction RPC->>DB: Update production_runs (status=completed, costs, timestamps) end DB-->>RPC: completed production_run RPC-->>Hooks: returns completed run Hooks-->>UI: update run state (Completed tab) UI-->>Kitchen: display updated stock, cost per unit, variance ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 4 (Complex) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~60 minutes ## Possibly related issues - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#33 ‚Äî Same unit-disambiguation change moving 'oz' ‚Üí 'fl oz' in conversion logic. - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#34 ‚Äî Related unit normalization updates affecting normalizeUnitName and conversion mappings. ## Possibly related PRs - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#100 ‚Äî Reorganizes MEASUREMENT_UNITS and introduces toIngredientUnit/isValidIngredientUnit utilities (closely related to recipeUnits changes). - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#146 ‚Äî Modifies ProductDialog conversion UX; overlaps with ProductDialog conversionSuggestion adjustments here. - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#256 ‚Äî Makes inventory/unit-conversion logic and tests similar to calculate_inventory_impact_for_product and associated RPC/test changes. ## Poem > üê∞ > *I nibbled on a recipe line,* > *Scaled cups to fl oz, costs in fine,* > *Batches bubble, inventories track,* > *Snapshots saved ‚Äî no turning back,* > *A little hop for kitchens divine!*
## Pre-merge checks and finishing touches

The required threshold is 80.00%. | You can run `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to improve docstring coverage. |
‚úÖ Passed checks (2 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :---------------: | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Description Check | ‚úÖ Passed | Check skipped - CodeRabbit‚Äôs high-level summary is enabled. | | Title check | ‚úÖ Passed | The title 'Feature/prepare recipes for inventory' is related to the main changeset, which adds prep recipe and production batch features. It accurately reflects the primary functionality being introduced. |

_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_ | _üü† Major_ **Use semantic color tokens instead of direct colors.** Lines 75 and 76 use direct Tailwind colors (`text-emerald-600`, `text-emerald-700`) instead of semantic tokens. Per coding guidelines: "Always use semantic color tokens (bg-background, text-foreground, border-border) instead of direct colors (bg-white, text-black, border-gray-300)." Consider using semantic tokens like `text-success` or defining a success color token in your design system. As per coding guidelines.
üîé Proposed fix ```diff
- - + + {stockDisplay} {stockUnit}
``` Note: Ensure `text-success` is defined in your Tailwind configuration as a semantic token.
> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.
ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents ``` In src/components/prep/PrepRecipeCard.tsx around lines 72 to 82, the stock color classes use direct Tailwind colors (text-emerald-600 and text-emerald-700); replace those with your design-system semantic color tokens (for example text-success and a matching foreground token such as text-success-foreground or font-medium text-success-foreground) so styling follows the semantic token convention, and ensure the referenced semantic token(s) are defined in the Tailwind config; update the className strings accordingly (keeping other classes like font-medium) and run a quick build/check to confirm the tokens exist. ```

**Avoid `any` type - use proper TypeScript type.**

The `restaurant` parameter is typed as `any`. Per coding guidelines, "Use TypeScript types everywhere - no `any` type unless justified with a comment." 

Use the proper restaurant type from your context or define an interface for it.



<details>

```diff
-  const handleRestaurantSelect = (restaurant: any) => {
+  const handleRestaurantSelect = (restaurant: { restaurant_id: string; restaurant?: { name: string } } | null) => {
     setSelectedRestaurant(restaurant);
   };
```
</details>


> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

**Ambiguous treatment of 'oz' in volume context.**

Line 112 treats plain `'oz'` as fluid ounces (`* 29.5735`), but per coding guidelines, `'oz'` should represent weight ounces while `'fl oz'` represents fluid ounces. This can cause incorrect inventory calculations when a recipe uses weight ounces but the container is volume-based.

Consider removing `'oz'` from the volume conversion branch and only handling `'fl oz'` for volume contexts.


<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
-        IF v_size_unit_lower IN ('gal','l','ml','qt','pint','cup') AND v_recipe_unit_lower IN ('fl oz','oz','ml','l','cup','tbsp','tsp','gal','qt','pint') THEN
+        IF v_size_unit_lower IN ('gal','l','ml','qt','pint','cup','fl oz') AND v_recipe_unit_lower IN ('fl oz','ml','l','cup','tbsp','tsp','gal','qt','pint') THEN
           v_recipe_in_ml := CASE v_recipe_unit_lower
             WHEN 'fl oz' THEN v_actual * 29.5735
-            WHEN 'oz' THEN v_actual * 29.5735
             WHEN 'ml' THEN v_actual
```
</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:medusa:ocelot -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment by CodeRabbit -->

‚úÖ Addressed in commits e67370e to c0964dc

- Converted to ml: 2.5 √ó 236.588 = 591.47 ml
- Converted to tbsp: 591.47 √∑ 14.7868 ‚âà 40 tbsp
- Expected stock: 1000 ‚àí 40 = **960 tbsp** (not 997.5)

correct conversions via ml (1 cup = 236.588 ml, 1 tbsp = 14.7868 ml, so 1 cup =
16 tbsp), recalculate the test: 0.25 cup √ó 10 = 2.5 cups ‚Üí 591.47 ml ‚Üí ‚âà40 tbsp,
so expected stock is 1000 ‚àí 40 = 960 tbsp, and change the BETWEEN assertion
bounds to BETWEEN 959.9 AND 960.1 and adjust the descriptive string to 'cup-tbsp
conversion: 1000 - 40 tbsp = 960 tbsp'.
```

</details>

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_

**Critical: ID collision with previous test.**

Product ID `'a0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000011'` and recipe ID `'b0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000011'` are already used in Test 17 (Chicken Breast / Grilled Chicken) at lines 548-559. This will cause conflicts and incorrect test results.

Additionally, line 873 deletes the recipe that was just used by Test 17, which breaks test isolation.



<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

Use unique IDs for the pint conversion test:

```diff
 -- Test 17: pint to ml (standard volume conversion)
 INSERT INTO products (id, restaurant_id, name, sku, uom_purchase, current_stock, cost_per_unit, size_value, size_unit) VALUES
-  ('a0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000011', '22222222-2222-2222-2222-222222222222', 'Milk', 'MILK-001', 'ml', 10000, 0.005, 1, 'ml')
+  ('a0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000020', '22222222-2222-2222-2222-222222222222', 'Milk', 'MILK-001', 'ml', 10000, 0.005, 1, 'ml')
 ON CONFLICT (id) DO UPDATE SET current_stock = 10000, cost_per_unit = 0.005;
 
--- Delete any existing recipe first
-DELETE FROM recipes WHERE id = 'b0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000011';

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

**Staff INSERT test assertion is misleading with RLS disabled.**

With RLS disabled, the staff user can actually INSERT rows, so the assertion "Staff cannot INSERT prep_recipes (row count unchanged)" at line 134 is inaccurate. The `results_eq` comparing before/after count doesn't prove the INSERT was blocked - it just confirms the count matches what it was.

Consider either:
1. Re-enabling RLS for this specific test
2. Using `throws_ok` to verify expected policy violation
3. Updating the test description to clarify what's being tested

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In supabase/tests/20251229120000_create_prep_production_tables.sql around lines
130‚Äì135 the test message "Staff cannot INSERT prep_recipes (row count
unchanged)" is incorrect because RLS is disabled so the test doesn't prove an
INSERT was blocked; fix by either 1) re-enable RLS for this test (enable
policies, run the INSERT as staff expecting failure, then restore RLS), 2)
replace the row-count equality check with a throws_ok-style assertion that
executes the INSERT as the staff role and asserts it raises a permission error,
or 3) if you intend to keep RLS off, update the test description to accurately
state what is being verified (e.g., "verify row count matches expected value
after staff INSERT with RLS disabled"). Ensure whichever approach you choose
updates or adds the necessary setup/teardown JWT/RLS commands and the assertion
accordingly.
```

</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:medusa:ocelot -->

items.title: <!-- This is an auto-generated comment: summarize by coderabbit.ai -->
items.body:
üìù Walkthrough ## Walkthrough Introduces a comprehensive prep production system with new pages for managing prep recipes and production batches, including database tables, RLS policies, complex inventory impact calculations, and business logic for creating, executing, and completing production runs with inventory and cost tracking. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Documentation**
`docs/PREP_RECIPES.md` | New comprehensive guide detailing end-to-end user journeys for kitchen staff, managers, and accountants; covers setup, daily operations, selling, variance handling, and accounting boundaries. | | **Pages & Routing**
`src/App.tsx`, `src/components/AppSidebar.tsx`, `src/pages/PrepRecipes.tsx`, `src/pages/Batches.tsx` | Added two new protected routes (`/prep-recipes`, `/batches`) with corresponding pages; extended sidebar navigation with "Prep Recipes" (Utensils icon) and "Batches" (Boxes icon) items. | | **Prep Recipe Management Components**
`src/components/prep/PrepRecipeCard.tsx`, `src/components/prep/PrepRecipeDialog.tsx` | New card component displaying recipe details (name, description, prep time, yields, costs, stock); new dialog for creating/editing prep recipes with full form state, ingredient rows, and submission flow. | | **Production Run UI Components**
`src/components/prep/NewProductionRunDialog.tsx`, `src/components/prep/ProductionRunCard.tsx`, `src/components/prep/ProductionRunDetailDialog.tsx` | Three new components: dialog for creating batches with ingredient plan and yield scaling; card displaying run status/yields/variance; comprehensive detail dialog for editing actual quantities, status, costs, and completing batches. | | **Hooks & State Management**
`src/hooks/usePrepRecipes.tsx`, `src/hooks/useProductionRuns.tsx` | Two new hooks managing prep recipes and production runs; includes fetching, creating, updating, deleting operations with cost calculations, output product resolution, and batch completion orchestration. | | **Unit System Refactoring**
`src/lib/recipeUnits.ts`, `src/lib/unitConversion.ts`, `src/hooks/useUnitConversion.tsx`, `src/components/ProductDialog.tsx`, `src/components/RecipeDialog.tsx`, `src/services/inventoryTransactions.service.ts`, `supabase/functions/_shared/inventoryTransactions.ts` | Disambiguates fluid ounces by replacing 'oz' with 'fl oz' across volume conversions; adds isValidIngredientUnit and toIngredientUnit utilities; updates ProductDialog conversion flow to use convertUnits with suggestion object structure; removes useUnitConversion from RecipeDialog; updates product queries to use uom_recipe instead of individual_unit. | | **Database Schema & Migrations**
`supabase/migrations/20251229120000_create_prep_production_tables.sql`, `supabase/migrations/20251229123000_complete_production_runs.sql`, `supabase/migrations/20251229124500_update_production_run_costs.sql`, `supabase/migrations/20251229130000_refactor_complete_production_runs.sql` | Four migrations creating prep_recipes, prep_recipe_ingredients, production_runs, production_run_ingredients tables with indexes and RLS policies; introduces complete_production_run RPC function and calculate_inventory_impact_for_product helper function with unit conversion logic; adds unit_cost_snapshot and total_cost_snapshot columns to track locked costs. | | **Type Definitions & Schema**
`src/integrations/supabase/types.ts`, `supabase/functions/ai-execute-tool/index.ts` | Removed individual_unit and individual_unit_size fields from products table type definitions; updated inventory transaction UI mapping to use uom_recipe instead of individual_unit. | | **Test Coverage**
`tests/e2e/prep-production.spec.ts`, `tests/unit/prepProductionHooks.test.tsx`, `tests/unit/prepProductionLogic.test.ts`, `tests/unit/unitConversion.test.ts`, `supabase/tests/12_prep_production_runs.sql`, `supabase/tests/13_conversion_helper.sql`, `supabase/tests/14_calculate_inventory_impact_conversions.sql`, `supabase/tests/15_production_run_costing.sql`, `supabase/tests/20251229120000_create_prep_production_tables.sql`, `supabase/tests/20251229130000_refactor_complete_production_runs.sql` | Comprehensive test suite: E2E test for full workflow (product ‚Üí recipe ‚Üí batch ‚Üí completion); unit tests for hooks and production logic (cost calculations, variance, batch scaling, inventory impact); SQL tests for RLS policies, inventory conversions, production run completion, and costing. | | **Maintenance**
`src/pages/Inventory.tsx`, `.gitignore` | Minor formatting in Inventory.tsx; added dev-tools entries to .gitignore (ingest-feedback.js, mark-task.js, next-task.js, refresh-queue.sh, review_queue.json, send-to-codex.sh). | ## Sequence Diagrams ```mermaid sequenceDiagram actor User participant PrepRecipesPage as PrepRecipes
(Page) participant PrepRecipeDialog as PrepRecipeDialog
(Component) participant usePrepRecipes as usePrepRecipes
(Hook) participant SupabaseDB as Supabase DB participant Toast as Toast
(Notification) User->>PrepRecipesPage: Open Prep Recipes, Click "Create Recipe" PrepRecipesPage->>PrepRecipeDialog: open=true User->>PrepRecipeDialog: Fill form (name, ingredients, yield, etc.) User->>PrepRecipeDialog: Click "Create Recipe" PrepRecipeDialog->>usePrepRecipes: createPrepRecipe(input) usePrepRecipes->>SupabaseDB: Insert prep_recipe SupabaseDB-->>usePrepRecipes: Return recipe ID usePrepRecipes->>SupabaseDB: Resolve/create output_product
(if needed) SupabaseDB-->>usePrepRecipes: Return product ID usePrepRecipes->>SupabaseDB: Insert prep_recipe_ingredients
(with ingredient rows) SupabaseDB-->>usePrepRecipes: Confirm usePrepRecipes->>usePrepRecipes: Fetch all recipes (refresh) usePrepRecipes-->>PrepRecipeDialog: Success + populated recipe PrepRecipeDialog->>Toast: Show success message PrepRecipeDialog->>PrepRecipesPage: onOpenChange(false) PrepRecipesPage->>PrepRecipesPage: Update prepRecipes list User->>User: See new recipe in list ``` ```mermaid sequenceDiagram actor User participant BatchesPage as Batches
(Page) participant NewProdDialog as NewProductionRunDialog
(Component) participant useProductionRuns as useProductionRuns
(Hook) participant ProdDetailDialog as ProductionRunDetailDialog
(Component) participant SupabaseDB as Supabase DB participant RPCFn as complete_production_run
(RPC) User->>BatchesPage: Open Batches, Click "Create Batch" BatchesPage->>NewProdDialog: open=true, prepRecipes User->>NewProdDialog: Select recipe, set yield, schedule time User->>NewProdDialog: Click "Create batch" NewProdDialog->>useProductionRuns: createProductionRun(input) useProductionRuns->>SupabaseDB: Insert production_run
(status: 'draft') SupabaseDB-->>useProductionRuns: Return run ID useProductionRuns->>SupabaseDB: Insert production_run_ingredients
(scaled to target yield) SupabaseDB-->>useProductionRuns: Confirm useProductionRuns-->>NewProdDialog: Return created run NewProdDialog->>BatchesPage: onOpenChange(false) rect rgba(100, 200, 100, 0.2) note over User,BatchesPage: Later: User reviews & completes batch end User->>BatchesPage: Click on batch card BatchesPage->>ProdDetailDialog: open=true, run data User->>ProdDetailDialog: Input actual yield & ingredient quantities User->>ProdDetailDialog: Click "Complete batch" ProdDetailDialog->>useProductionRuns: saveRunActuals(payload) useProductionRuns->>SupabaseDB: Call RPC: complete_production_run() RPCFn->>SupabaseDB: For each ingredient:
calculate_inventory_impact_for_product() SupabaseDB->>SupabaseDB: Convert units, deduct product stock SupabaseDB->>SupabaseDB: Log inventory_transactions
(ingredient deductions) RPCFn->>SupabaseDB: If output product exists:
increment stock SupabaseDB->>SupabaseDB: Log inventory_transaction
(output increment) RPCFn->>SupabaseDB: Update production_run
(status: 'completed', costs, actuals) SupabaseDB-->>RPCFn: Return updated run useProductionRuns-->>ProdDetailDialog: Success ProdDetailDialog->>BatchesPage: onOpenChange(false) BatchesPage->>BatchesPage: Refresh runs list User->>User: See batch marked completed
& inventory updated ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 4 (Complex) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~60 minutes **Reasoning:** This PR introduces substantial new functionality spanning React components, custom hooks with complex data orchestration, database schema with RLS policies, sophisticated inventory conversion logic, and extensive test coverage. The changes are heterogeneous‚Äîmixing UI logic, state management, database migrations, unit system refactoring, and business rules‚Äîeach requiring separate reasoning. Key areas of concern include: (1) complex nested state in hooks (usePrepRecipes, useProductionRuns) with cost calculations and product resolution; (2) intricate SQL functions with unit conversion fallback strategies and inventory deductions; (3) widespread unit system changes ('oz' ‚Üí 'fl oz') affecting multiple utilities; (4) RLS policy enforcement across four new tables; and (5) numerous interdependencies between client and database layers. While individual components are well-isolated, the overall scope and logic density warrant careful review. ## Possibly related issues - **#33**: Directly addresses the fluid ounce disambiguation (replacing 'oz' with 'fl oz' for volume) that this PR implements across unit conversion utilities and hooks. - **#34**: Matches the suggested unit handling refactor (oz‚Üíweight, floz‚Üívolume adjustment) that this PR executes in useUnitConversion, unitConversion, and recipeUnits modules. ## Possibly related PRs - **PR `#146`**: Both modify `src/components/ProductDialog.tsx`‚Äîthis PR updates unit-conversion flow with convertUnits and suggestion object structure; PR `#146` adjusts form fields, validation, and supplier logic in the same component. - **PR `#256`**: Both address inventory unit conversion and deduction logic‚Äîthis PR implements DB-side calculate_inventory_impact_for_product and complete_production_run functions; PR `#256` introduces a TypeScript mirror utility for conversion/deduction and related tests. - **PR `#175`**: Both modify app navigation and routing (src/App.tsx, src/components/AppSidebar.tsx)‚Äîthis PR adds /prep-recipes and /batches routes; PR `#175` adds other new routes and sidebar items, creating potential conflict. ## Poem > üê∞ *A burrow of recipes, a garden of yields,* > *From kitchen to counts, what production reveals:* > *Ingredients scaled, batches complete,* > *Inventory dances‚Äîno prep's ever beat!*

The required threshold is 80.00%. | You can run `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to improve docstring coverage. |

**Add accessibility attributes to the yield input.**

The numeric input for "Actual yield" lacks an `aria-label` or explicit `id` linking to the `Label`. Per coding guidelines, always add accessibility features to interactive components.

```diff

                   <Input

                     type="number"
                     min="0"
                     step="0.01"
                     value={actualYield}
                     onChange={(e) => setActualYield(e.target.value ? parseFloat(e.target.value) : '')}
+                    aria-describedby="actual-yield-hint"
                   />
```
</details>

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

**Delete-then-insert pattern for updating ingredients is not atomic.**

The update flow deletes all existing ingredients and then inserts new ones. If the insert fails after deletion, the recipe is left with no ingredients. Consider wrapping this in a transaction or using upsert patterns.



<details>
<summary>üîé Consider using a database function for atomic updates</summary>

```sql
-- Could create an RPC function that handles this atomically
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION update_prep_recipe_ingredients(
  p_recipe_id UUID,
  p_ingredients JSONB
) RETURNS void AS $$
BEGIN
  DELETE FROM prep_recipe_ingredients WHERE prep_recipe_id = p_recipe_id;
  INSERT INTO prep_recipe_ingredients (prep_recipe_id, product_id, quantity, unit, notes, sort_order)
  SELECT p_recipe_id, (ing->>'product_id')::uuid, ...
  FROM jsonb_array_elements(p_ingredients) AS ing;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;
```
</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:medusa:ocelot -->

üåê Web query:

`difference between oz and fl oz fluid ounces weight ounces conversion`

üí° Result:

Short answer
- "oz" (ounce) normally means an ounce of weight (avoirdupois): 1 oz = 28.349523125 g. [1]
- "fl oz" (fluid ounce, abbreviated fl. oz.) is a volume unit: 1 US fl oz = 29.5735295625 mL (Imperial/UK fl oz differs). [2]

How to convert between them
- You cannot convert volume (fl oz) to weight (oz) without the substance's density.
- General formula: weight (oz) = volume (fl oz) √ó (mL per fl oz) √ó (density in g/mL) √∑ 28.349523125. For water (‚âà1.00 g/mL) 1 US fl oz ‚âà 1.043 oz (by weight). [3]

If you want, tell me the substance (e.g., water, milk, flour) and amount and I‚Äôll convert it.

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
cat supabase/migrations/20251229123000_complete_production_runs.sql | head -150
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 5087

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell

```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

üèÅ Script executed:

```

Length of output: 22342

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell

```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 4926

---



</details>

**Remove 'oz' from volume context conversion logic‚Äîit must only appear in weight contexts.**

The code at lines 109-122 treats recipe unit 'oz' as fluid ounces (29.5735 ml) when the container size_unit is a volume unit. This violates the established coding guideline: liquids use 'fl oz' and solids use 'oz'‚Äînever mix volume and weight units.

The refactored function in `20251229130000_refactor_complete_production_runs.sql` correctly removes 'oz' from the volume context check and only allows 'fl oz'. The TypeScript library `enhancedUnitConversion.ts` also enforces this separation: `WEIGHT_UNITS = ['lb', 'kg', 'g', 'oz']` and `VOLUME_UNITS = ['fl oz', 'cup', 'tbsp', 'tsp', 'ml', 'L', 'gal', 'qt']`, with 'oz' using 28.3495 g/oz for weight conversions.

Update the volume context condition from:
```
v_recipe_unit_lower IN ('fl oz','oz','ml','l','cup','tbsp','tsp','gal','qt','pint')
```
to:
```
v_recipe_unit_lower IN ('fl oz','ml','l','cup','tbsp','tsp','gal','qt','pint')
```

This ensures 'oz' only appears in weight context conversions (where it is correctly treated as 28.3495 grams per ounce).

Additionally, add corresponding pgTAP tests to verify volume and weight conversions work independently.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In supabase/migrations/20251229123000_complete_production_runs.sql around lines
109 to 122, the recipe volume conversion block incorrectly treats 'oz' as a
volume unit (fluid ounces) ‚Äî remove 'oz' from the v_recipe_unit_lower IN (...)
list so only 'fl oz' remains in the volume context; update the IN list to
exclude 'oz' and leave weight-only handling of 'oz' to the weight-conversion
path (where 1 oz = 28.3495 g). After changing the IN-list, ensure the CASE
mapping stays unchanged (keep 'fl oz' -> 29.5735 ml) and add pgTAP tests that
assert: volume conversions accept 'fl oz' but not 'oz', and weight conversions
accept 'oz' as 28.3495 g to verify volume and weight conversions are enforced
separately.
```

</details>

items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

**Staff INSERT test is ineffective with RLS disabled.**

With RLS disabled (line 75-78), staff can actually insert records. The test at line 134 only verifies row count matches current count, which doesn't prove the INSERT was blocked - it may have succeeded and the count comparison passes because you're comparing to the post-insert count.

This test gives false confidence. Either enable RLS or use `throws_ok` to verify the insert is rejected.

`tests/unit/prepProductionHooks.test.tsx`, `tests/unit/prepProductionLogic.test.ts`, `tests/unit/unitConversion.test.ts`, `tests/e2e/prep-production.spec.ts` | Unit tests for production hooks and logic, unit conversion utilities; E2E test for complete production workflow | | **Minor Changes**
`src/pages/Inventory.tsx` | Whitespace-only formatting adjustment in filteredProducts memo | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User as User participant UI as React UI participant Hook as usePrepRecipes/
useProductionRuns participant DB as Supabase

(scaled quantities) DB-->>Hook: Return run Hook-->>UI: Batch created UI-->>User: Show batch card User->>UI: Enter actual yield & ingredients UI->>Hook: saveRunActuals(payload) Hook->>DB: CALL complete_production_run()
(actuals, ingredient overrides) DB->>DB: For each ingredient:
convert unit & calc inventory impact DB->>DB: Deduct ingredient stock DB->>DB: Add output product stock DB->>DB: INSERT inventory_transactions
(inputs & output) DB->>DB: Update run with variance
& cost snapshots DB-->>Hook: Return completed run Hook-->>UI: Run completed UI-->>User: Show updated batch
with costs & variance end ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 4 (Complex) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~60 minutes ## Possibly related issues - **#33**: Unit conversion ambiguity between 'oz' (weight) and fluid ounces is directly addressed by the fl oz refactoring in src/hooks/useUnitConversion.tsx and src/lib/unitConversion.ts - **#34**: Related unit-conversion refactor for disambiguating oz vs fl oz in unit mappings and category lists matches the changes to unit utilities across the PR ## Possibly related PRs - **#24**: Modifies unit-conversion logic (enhancedUnitConversion) which overlaps with this PR's refactoring of useUnitConversion and unitConversion utilities - **#256**: Addresses inventory conversion logic and shared client-side/database conversion mirrors; this PR adds calculate_inventory_impact_for_product at the SQL level which is directly related - **#261**: Modifies Supabase product schema (removing individual_unit/individual_unit_size fields) which is the same schema change made in this PR's src/integrations/supabase/types.ts ## Poem > üê∞ A recipe takes shape, ingredients aligned, > Prep runs scale smoothly‚Äîyields well-designed, > Costs lock in place as batches complete, > The kitchen's heartbeat, now honest and sweet! ‚ú®

items.body:
_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_ | _üü† Major_

**Add accessibility attributes to the yield input.**

The numeric input for "Actual yield" lacks an `aria-label` or explicit `id` linking to the `Label`. Per coding guidelines, always add accessibility features to interactive components.



<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
               <div className="space-y-1">
-                <Label>Actual yield</Label>
+                <Label htmlFor="actual-yield">Actual yield</Label>
                 <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
                   <Input
+                    id="actual-yield"
                     type="number"
                     min="0"
                     step="0.01"
                     value={actualYield}
                     onChange={(e) => setActualYield(e.target.value ? parseFloat(e.target.value) : '')}
+                    aria-describedby="actual-yield-hint"
                   />
```
</details>


> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In src/components/prep/ProductionRunDetailDialog.tsx around lines 148 to 156,
the numeric "Actual yield" input lacks accessibility attributes; add an explicit
id (e.g., id="actual-yield") to the Input and update the Label to reference it
via htmlFor="actual-yield" (or alternatively add an aria-label="Actual yield" on
the Input if not using htmlFor), ensuring the id is unique in the form and
keeping the same value/onChange behavior.
```

</details>

_üõ†Ô∏è Refactor suggestion_ | _üü† Major_

**Add accessibility label to ingredient quantity input.**

The input for actual ingredient quantity lacks an accessible name. Screen readers won't properly announce what this input controls.



<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
                           <Input
                             type="number"
                             min="0"
                             step="0.01"
                             value={actual}
+                            aria-label={`Actual quantity for ${ing.product?.name || 'ingredient'}`}
                             onChange={(e) => {
                               const updated = [...ingredientActuals];
                               updated[idx] = { ...ing, actual_quantity: parseFloat(e.target.value) || 0 };
                               setIngredientActuals(updated);
                             }}
                           />
```
</details>

<!-- suggestion_start -->

<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
                            <Input
                              type="number"
                              min="0"
                              step="0.01"
                              value={actual}
                              aria-label={`Actual quantity for ${ing.product?.name || 'ingredient'}`}
                              onChange={(e) => {
                                const updated = [...ingredientActuals];
                                updated[idx] = { ...ing, actual_quantity: parseFloat(e.target.value) || 0 };
                                setIngredientActuals(updated);
                              }}

```

</details>

``supabase/tests/*`` (12,13,14,15,20251229120000,20251229130000) | New pgTAP-style tests covering RLS, conversion helpers, inventory impact, costing, and production run lifecycles. | | **Client hooks (new)**
``src/hooks/usePrepRecipes.tsx``, ``src/hooks/useProductionRuns.tsx`` | New hooks exposing CRUD and business logic: recipe CRUD, production run create/update/complete, scaling, cost aggregation, inventory sync, and typed domain models. | | **Unit conversion & units**
``src/hooks/useUnitConversion.tsx``, ``src/lib/unitConversion.ts``, ``src/lib/recipeUnits.ts`` | Disambiguates volume using `fl oz`, expands MEASUREMENT_UNITS, updates category detection and normalization, and adjusts suggestion logic. | | **Prep UI components (new)**
``src/components/prep/PrepRecipeDialog.tsx``, ``src/components/prep/PrepRecipeCard.tsx``, ``src/components/prep/NewProductionRunDialog.tsx``, ``src/components/prep/ProductionRunCard.tsx``, ``src/components/prep/ProductionRunDetailDialog.tsx`` | New dialogs/cards/detail views for creating/editing prep recipes and managing production runs (scaling, actuals, variance, costs). | | **Pages & routing**
``src/pages/PrepRecipes.tsx``, ``src/pages/Batches.tsx``, ``src/App.tsx`` | Adds Prep Recipes and Batches pages and routes; wires pages into App routes. | | **Sidebar/navigation**
``src/components/AppSidebar.tsx`` | Adds Prep Recipes and Batches items (Utensils, Boxes icons) under Inventory nav group. | | **Product/Recipe UI updates**
``src/components/ProductDialog.tsx``, ``src/components/RecipeDialog.tsx`` | ProductDialog: replaces hook-based unit conversion with centralized convertUnits and shows suggested conversion; RecipeDialog: removes useUnitConversion dependency. | | **Supabase types & services**
``src/integrations/supabase/types.ts``, ``src/services/inventoryTransactions.service.ts``, ``supabase/functions/_shared/inventoryTransactions.ts``, ``supabase/functions/ai-execute-tool/index.ts`` | Removes `individual_unit`/`individual_unit_size` from product types and switches inventory transaction code paths to use `uom_recipe`. | | **Tests ‚Äî client**
``tests/unit/prepProductionHooks.test.tsx``, ``tests/unit/prepProductionLogic.test.ts``, ``tests/unit/unitConversion.test.ts``, ``tests/e2e/prep-production.spec.ts`` | Adds unit tests for hooks/logic/unit conversions and an end-to-end Playwright spec exercising the full prep production flow. | | **Minor**
``src/pages/Inventory.tsx`` | Whitespace-only adjustment in filteredProducts memo. | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User as User participant UI as React UI participant Hooks as usePrepRecipes / useProductionRuns participant DB as Supabase DB rect `#DDEEFF` Note over User,DB: Create Prep Recipe User->>UI: Submit recipe form UI->>Hooks: createPrepRecipe(input) Hooks->>DB: INSERT prep_recipes + INSERT prep_recipe_ingredients DB-->>Hooks: created recipe Hooks-->>UI: return recipe end rect `#EEFFEE` Note over User,DB: Create & Complete Production Run User->>UI: Create run from recipe UI->>Hooks: createProductionRun(recipe, target_yield) Hooks->>DB: INSERT production_runs + production_run_ingredients (scaled) DB-->>Hooks: created run User->>UI: Submit actuals UI->>Hooks: saveRunActuals(payload) Hooks->>DB: CALL complete_production_run(runId, actuals...) DB->>DB: convert units, update stocks, insert inventory_transactions, snapshot costs DB-->>Hooks: completed run Hooks-->>UI: updated run (status: completed, costs, variance) end ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 4 (Complex) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~60 minutes ## Possibly related issues - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#34 ‚Äî Unit conversion ambiguity (oz vs fl oz): addressed by fl oz refactor in unit conversion code. - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#33 ‚Äî Similar unit-conversion mapping changes and category adjustments present in this PR. ## Possibly related PRs - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#112 ‚Äî Touches ProductDialog and unit/packaging conversion UI, overlapping ProductDialog refactor here. - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#256 ‚Äî Related to inventory conversion logic and client/server conversion mirrors; this PR adds SQL calculate_inventory_impact_for_product and related tests. - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#261 ‚Äî Modifies Supabase product schema; this PR removes `individual_unit`/`individual_unit_size` from types and updates queries. ## Poem > üê∞ I hopped through recipes, scaled every line, > Cups turned to fl oz and the batches align. > Costs locked like carrots snug in a sack, > Batches complete ‚Äî no ingredient lacks. > A tiny rabbit cheers: hop, mix, and pack! ü•ï‚ú®
## Pre-merge checks and finishing touches

The required threshold is 80.00%. | You can run `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to improve docstring coverage. |

**Add accessibility label to the unit Select component.**

                     </SelectTrigger>
```

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

**Delete-then-insert pattern for updating ingredients is not atomic.**

The update flow deletes all existing ingredients and then inserts new ones. If the insert fails after deletion, the recipe is left with no ingredients. Consider wrapping this in a transaction or using upsert patterns.



<details>
<summary>üîé Consider using a database function for atomic updates</summary>

```sql
-- Could create an RPC function that handles this atomically
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION update_prep_recipe_ingredients(
  p_recipe_id UUID,
  p_ingredients JSONB
) RETURNS void AS $$
BEGIN
  DELETE FROM prep_recipe_ingredients WHERE prep_recipe_id = p_recipe_id;
  INSERT INTO prep_recipe_ingredients (prep_recipe_id, product_id, quantity, unit, notes, sort_order)
  SELECT p_recipe_id, (ing->>'product_id')::uuid, ...
  FROM jsonb_array_elements(p_ingredients) AS ing;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;
```
</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:medusa:ocelot -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment by CodeRabbit -->

‚úÖ Addressed in commits 3ea078b to de09195

items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

<details>
<summary>üß© Analysis chain</summary>

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
find . -name "*.sql" -type f | grep -E "(migration|20251229)" | head -20
```

```

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
find supabase/tests -type f -name "*.sql" 2>/dev/null | head -20
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 936

---

üåê Web query:

`difference between oz and fl oz fluid ounces weight ounces conversion`

üí° Result:

Short answer
- "oz" (ounce) normally means an ounce of weight (avoirdupois): 1 oz = 28.349523125 g. [1]
- "fl oz" (fluid ounce, abbreviated fl. oz.) is a volume unit: 1 US fl oz = 29.5735295625 mL (Imperial/UK fl oz differs). [2]

How to convert between them
- You cannot convert volume (fl oz) to weight (oz) without the substance's density.
- General formula: weight (oz) = volume (fl oz) √ó (mL per fl oz) √ó (density in g/mL) √∑ 28.349523125. For water (‚âà1.00 g/mL) 1 US fl oz ‚âà 1.043 oz (by weight). [3]

If you want, tell me the substance (e.g., water, milk, flour) and amount and I‚Äôll convert it.

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
cat supabase/migrations/20251229123000_complete_production_runs.sql | head -150
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 5087

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
cat supabase/migrations/20251229130000_refactor_complete_production_runs.sql | head -150
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 5599

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
cat src/lib/enhancedUnitConversion.ts
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 22342

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
cat supabase/tests/20251229130000_refactor_complete_production_runs.sql | head -100
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 4926

---



</details>

**Remove 'oz' from volume context conversion logic‚Äîit must only appear in weight contexts.**

The code at lines 109-122 treats recipe unit 'oz' as fluid ounces (29.5735 ml) when the container size_unit is a volume unit. This violates the established coding guideline: liquids use 'fl oz' and solids use 'oz'‚Äînever mix volume and weight units.

The refactored function in `20251229130000_refactor_complete_production_runs.sql` correctly removes 'oz' from the volume context check and only allows 'fl oz'. The TypeScript library `enhancedUnitConversion.ts` also enforces this separation: `WEIGHT_UNITS = ['lb', 'kg', 'g', 'oz']` and `VOLUME_UNITS = ['fl oz', 'cup', 'tbsp', 'tsp', 'ml', 'L', 'gal', 'qt']`, with 'oz' using 28.3495 g/oz for weight conversions.

Update the volume context condition from:
```
v_recipe_unit_lower IN ('fl oz','oz','ml','l','cup','tbsp','tsp','gal','qt','pint')
```
to:
```
v_recipe_unit_lower IN ('fl oz','ml','l','cup','tbsp','tsp','gal','qt','pint')
```

This ensures 'oz' only appears in weight context conversions (where it is correctly treated as 28.3495 grams per ounce).

Additionally, add corresponding pgTAP tests to verify volume and weight conversions work independently.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In supabase/migrations/20251229123000_complete_production_runs.sql around lines
109 to 122, the recipe volume conversion block incorrectly treats 'oz' as a
volume unit (fluid ounces) ‚Äî remove 'oz' from the v_recipe_unit_lower IN (...)
list so only 'fl oz' remains in the volume context; update the IN list to
exclude 'oz' and leave weight-only handling of 'oz' to the weight-conversion
path (where 1 oz = 28.3495 g). After changing the IN-list, ensure the CASE
mapping stays unchanged (keep 'fl oz' -> 29.5735 ml) and add pgTAP tests that
assert: volume conversions accept 'fl oz' but not 'oz', and weight conversions
accept 'oz' as 28.3495 g to verify volume and weight conversions are enforced
separately.
```

</details>

**Apply unit conversion to output product when adding to inventory.**

The function determines `p_actual_yield_unit` at line 130 but never uses it when updating the output product's stock at line 134. Similar to ingredient handling (line 77-82), the output yield should be converted to the product's `uom_purchase` using `calculate_inventory_impact_for_product()` before adding to `current_stock`. If they differ, quantities will be incompatible.

<details>

In supabase/migrations/20251229130000_refactor_complete_production_runs.sql

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

**Staff INSERT test is ineffective with RLS disabled.**

With RLS disabled (line 75-78), staff can actually insert records. The test at line 134 only verifies row count matches current count, which doesn't prove the INSERT was blocked - it may have succeeded and the count comparison passes because you're comparing to the post-insert count.

This test gives false confidence. Either enable RLS or use `throws_ok` to verify the insert is rejected.

**Replace `any` with `unknown` and add type guards in all error handlers**

All four error handlers (lines 125, 376, 427, 456) use `catch (err: any)` and unsafely access `err.message` without type narrowing. This violates the "no `any` without justification" guideline.

Use `catch (err: unknown)` with a type guard instead:

<details>
<summary>Suggested pattern</summary>

```ts
catch (err: unknown) {
  console.error('Error fetching prep recipes:', err);
  const message = err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unexpected error';
  setError(message);
  toast({
    title: 'Could not load prep recipes',
    description: message,
    variant: 'destructive',
  });
}
```
</details>

Apply consistently to all four methods: `fetchPrepRecipes`, `createPrepRecipe`, `updatePrepRecipe`, and `deletePrepRecipe`.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

~376, ~427, ~456), the catch blocks use `catch (err: any)` and access
`err.message` unsafely; replace `any` with `unknown` and add a type guard to
extract a safe message: use `catch (err: unknown)`, log the raw err, then
compute `const message = err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unexpected
error'`, pass `message` to setError and toasts (and any other error consumers).
Apply this pattern consistently to fetchPrepRecipes, createPrepRecipe,
updatePrepRecipe, and deletePrepRecipe so no catch block uses `any` or directly
accesses `err.message` without narrowing.
```

</details>

</details>

**Add `restaurant_id` filters to all Supabase queries and mutations in this hook for proper tenant isolation**

The repository guideline explicitly requires: "Always filter by `restaurant_id`" and "NEVER query without restaurant filter" (see `.github/copilot-instructions.md`). Currently, four functions violate this:

1. **`calculateIngredientCostTotal` (lines 192-195)**: Queries products by `.in('id', ingredientProductIds)` without restaurant filter. Add `restaurant_id` parameter to function and chain `.eq('restaurant_id', restaurant_id)`.

2. **`updateExistingOutputProduct` (lines 259-281)**: Queries and updates products by `.eq('id', outputProductId)` without restaurant filter. Add `restaurant_id` parameter and apply filter to both select and update.

3. **`updatePrepRecipe` (lines 394-397)**: Updates prep_recipes by `.eq('id', id)` without restaurant filter. The function receives `UpdatePrepRecipeInput` which includes `restaurant_id`‚Äîadd `.eq('restaurant_id', input.restaurant_id)` to the mutation.

4. **`deletePrepRecipe` (lines 442-445)**: Deletes prep_recipes by `.eq('id', id)` without restaurant filter. Add `restaurant_id` parameter and filter.

Queries elsewhere in this hook (lines 217, 235, 310) correctly include the restaurant filter. This is a security gap that violates data isolation principles.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In src/hooks/usePrepRecipes.tsx around lines 188 to 205 (and related functions
at lines ~259-281, ~394-397, ~442-445), several Supabase queries/mutations lack
the required restaurant_id tenant filter: add a restaurant_id parameter to
calculateIngredientCostTotal and updateExistingOutputProduct (or accept it from
scope where called) and include .eq('restaurant_id', restaurant_id) chained to
the .in/.select/.update calls; for updatePrepRecipe use input.restaurant_id and
add .eq('restaurant_id', input.restaurant_id) to the update query; for
deletePrepRecipe accept restaurant_id and add .eq('restaurant_id',
restaurant_id) to the delete query ‚Äî ensure every Supabase query/mutation in
this hook includes the restaurant_id equality filter to enforce tenant
isolation.
```

</details>

items.body:
üìù Walkthrough ## Walkthrough Implements Prep Production: DB schema and server functions for prep recipes and production runs, client hooks and UI (pages/components) to manage recipes and batches, unit-conversion refactors (fl oz vs oz), supabase type/service updates, and extensive SQL/unit/E2E tests. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Configuration**
`\`.gitignore\`` | Adds dev-tool scripts and artifacts to ignore list (ingest-feedback.js, mark-task.js, next-task.js, refresh-queue.sh, review_queue.json, send-to-codex.sh, README.md, .env.local.example). | | **Documentation**
`docs/PREP_RECIPES.md` | New comprehensive guide describing Prep Production workflows, roles, UX, and state transitions. | | **DB schema & migrations**
`supabase/migrations/..._create_prep_production_tables.sql`, `..._complete_production_runs.sql`, `..._update_production_run_costs.sql`, `..._refactor_complete_production_runs.sql`, `..._update_prep_recipe_ingredients_function.sql` | Adds prep_recipes, prep_recipe_ingredients, production_runs, production_run_ingredients, enum `production_run_status`, RLS policies, cost snapshot columns, helper functions (calculate_inventory_impact_for_product, complete_production_run, update_prep_recipe_ingredients). | | **SQL tests**
`supabase/tests/*` (12,13,14,15,20251229120000,20251229130000) | New pgTAP-style tests covering RLS, conversion helpers, inventory impact, costing, and production run lifecycles. | | **Client hooks**
`src/hooks/usePrepRecipes.tsx`, `src/hooks/useProductionRuns.tsx` | New hooks exposing typed domain models and APIs: fetch/create/update/delete prep recipes; create/update/complete production runs; scaling, cost aggregation, supplier/output product resolution, and data normalization. | | **Unit conversion & units**
`src/hooks/useUnitConversion.tsx`, `src/lib/unitConversion.ts`, `src/lib/recipeUnits.ts` | Disambiguates fluid ounces to `fl oz`, expands MEASUREMENT_UNITS, updates category detection, normalization, and suggestion logic. | | **Prep UI components**
`src/components/prep/PrepRecipeDialog.tsx`, `src/components/prep/PrepRecipeCard.tsx`, `src/components/prep/NewProductionRunDialog.tsx`, `src/components/prep/ProductionRunCard.tsx`, `src/components/prep/ProductionRunDetailDialog.tsx` | New dialogs, cards, and detail views for creating/editing prep recipes and managing production runs (scaling, actuals, variance, cost snapshots). | | **Pages & routing**
`src/pages/PrepRecipes.tsx`, `src/pages/Batches.tsx`, `src/App.tsx` | Adds Prep Recipes and Batches pages and routes; wires pages into app routing. | | **Sidebar / navigation**
`src/components/AppSidebar.tsx` | Adds Prep Recipes and Batches nav items (Utensils, Boxes icons) under Inventory group. | | **Product / Recipe UI updates**
`src/components/ProductDialog.tsx`, `src/components/RecipeDialog.tsx` | ProductDialog: replace hook-based conversion with centralized convertUnits and show suggested conversion; RecipeDialog: remove useUnitConversion dependency. | | **Supabase types & services**
`src/integrations/supabase/types.ts`, `src/services/inventoryTransactions.service.ts`, `supabase/functions/_shared/inventoryTransactions.ts`, `supabase/functions/ai-execute-tool/index.ts` | Removes `individual_unit`/`individual_unit_size` from product types and switches inventory transaction codepaths to use `uom_recipe`; adds DB function type for update_prep_recipe_ingredients. | | **Client tests & e2e**
`tests/unit/*`, `tests/e2e/prep-production.spec.ts` | Adds unit tests for hooks/logic/unit conversions and a Playwright E2E spec exercising full prep-production flow. | | **Minor**
`src/pages/Inventory.tsx` | Whitespace-only change in filteredProducts memo. | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User as User participant UI as React UI participant Hooks as usePrepRecipes / useProductionRuns participant DB as Supabase DB rect `#E8F0FF` Note over User,UI: Create Prep Recipe User->>UI: Submit recipe form UI->>Hooks: createPrepRecipe(input) Hooks->>DB: INSERT prep_recipes + INSERT prep_recipe_ingredients DB-->>Hooks: created recipe Hooks-->>UI: return recipe end rect `#EEF8EA` Note over User,DB: Create & Complete Production Run User->>UI: Create run from recipe (target yield) UI->>Hooks: createProductionRun(recipe, target_yield) Hooks->>DB: INSERT production_runs + production_run_ingredients (scaled) DB-->>Hooks: created run User->>UI: Submit actuals & ingredient overrides UI->>Hooks: saveRunActuals(payload) Hooks->>DB: CALL complete_production_run(runId, actual_yield, unit, ingredients) DB->>DB: convert units, update stocks, insert inventory_transactions, snapshot costs DB-->>Hooks: completed run (status, costs, variance) Hooks-->>UI: updated run end ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 4 (Complex) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~60 minutes ## Possibly related issues - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#34 ‚Äî Unit conversion ambiguity (oz vs fl oz): this PR renames/adjusts unit mappings to use `fl oz`. - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#33 ‚Äî Similar unit-conversion mapping changes and category adjustments present here. ## Possibly related PRs - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#112 ‚Äî Overlaps ProductDialog unit-conversion refactor and UI changes. - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#256 ‚Äî Related inventory conversion logic; both add/modify server-side conversion and costing. - toyiyo/nimble-pnl#261 ‚Äî Related Supabase product type changes (removal/rename of individual_unit fields) and caller updates. ## Poem > üê∞ I hopped through recipes, scaled every line, > Cups turned to fl oz and the batches align. > Costs locked like carrots snug in a sack, > Batches complete ‚Äî no ingredient lacks. > A tiny rabbit cheers: hop, mix, and pack! ü•ï‚ú®

items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_

**Move `.last_task_id` to `.gitignore` to prevent runtime state from polluting version control.**

This file stores a dynamic task ID that changes during workflow execution. Tracking it in Git causes frequent diffs unrelated to code changes, creates merge conflicts, and clutters the repository history with transient state. Runtime artifacts should not be version controlled.

<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

Remove line 1 from dev-tools/.last_task_id and add it back to .gitignore:

**Step 1: Delete the file from tracking**
```shell
git rm --cached dev-tools/.last_task_id
```

**Step 2: Update .gitignore**
```diff
 stripe.tar.gz
+dev-tools/.last_task_id
```

**Step 3: Create local version for dev use (not tracked)**
Ensure the script writes to a local `.last_task_id` file that developers have in their .gitignore locally.
</details>

Verify that `dev-tools/next-task.js` and `dev-tools/mark-last-task.sh` are designed to work with a local (untracked) version of this file.



> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In dev-tools/.last_task_id around lines 1 to 1: this file contains transient
runtime state and should not be tracked; remove it from Git tracking (git rm
--cached dev-tools/.last_task_id), add dev-tools/.last_task_id to .gitignore,
and commit the change; then verify and, if necessary, update
dev-tools/next-task.js and dev-tools/mark-last-task.sh so they create or
tolerate a missing local .last_task_id (e.g., initialize when absent, avoid
failing if file missing) to ensure workflows continue to work with an untracked
local copy.
```

</details>

**Test command may fail for nested test files.**

Using only `path.basename(testFile)` in the test command might not work for test files in subdirectories. The test runner may not be able to locate the file without its relative path.



<details>

_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

**Handle empty `NOTES` array to prevent unbound variable error.**

With `set -u` enabled, iterating over an empty array `${NOTES[@]}` can cause an "unbound variable" error in older Bash versions. Use `${NOTES[@]+"${NOTES[@]}"}` or check if the array has elements first.


<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
 ARGS=(--id "$ID" --status "$STATUS")
-for n in "${NOTES[@]}"; do
-  ARGS+=(--note "$n")
-done
+if [[ ${#NOTES[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
+  for n in "${NOTES[@]}"; do
+    ARGS+=(--note "$n")
+  done
+fi
```
</details>

<!-- suggestion_start -->

<details>
<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

> ‚ÄºÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**
> Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation. Thoroughly test & benchmark the code to ensure it meets the requirements.

```suggestion
ARGS=(--id "$ID" --status "$STATUS")
if [[ ${#NOTES[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
  for n in "${NOTES[@]}"; do
    ARGS+=(--note "$n")
  done
fi
```

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

<details>
<summary>üß© Analysis chain</summary>

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
# Find references to bank_account_balances and connected_banks
rg -n "bank_account_balances|connected_banks" --type=ts --type=sql -C 2 | head -100
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 9353

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
# Look for schema definitions or migrations
fd -e "sql" -e "ts" | grep -E "(schema|migration|database)" | head -20
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 1580

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
# Check the supabase directory structure for schema files
find . -type f -name "*.sql" | head -20
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 1340

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
# Look at useBankTransactions.tsx to see context and function calls
rg -n "applyMetadataFilters|restaurantId|bankAccountId" "src/hooks/useBankTransactions.tsx" -B2 -A2 | head -80
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 1924

---

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
# Check the full signature and usage of fetchTransactionsPage and applyMetadataFilters
sed -n '120,200p' "src/hooks/useBankTransactions.tsx"
```

Repository: toyiyo/nimble-pnl

Length of output: 3357

---



</details>

**Add error handling and explicit restaurant_id filtering for the bank account balance lookup.**

The `applyMetadataFilters` function has two issues:

1. **Silent failure without logging**: If the `bank_account_balances` query fails, the error is silently swallowed and the filter is skipped. Users won't know the filter didn't apply.

2. **Missing explicit restaurant_id filtering**: Per coding guidelines, queries should filter by `restaurant_id` in code for data isolation, not rely solely on RLS. The `bank_account_balances` lookup doesn't include this explicit filter.

The fix needs to pass `restaurantId` from the calling context and add error handling. Note: the proposed syntax using `.eq('connected_banks.restaurant_id', ...)` won't work in the Supabase JS client‚Äîinstead, filter directly on `bank_account_balances` by passing the `restaurantId` through the function signature.

<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
-const applyMetadataFilters = async (query: any, filters: TransactionFilters) => {
+const applyMetadataFilters = async (query: any, filters: TransactionFilters, restaurantId: string) => {
   if (filters.status) query = query.eq('status', filters.status);
   if (filters.transactionType === 'debit') query = query.lt('amount', 0);
   if (filters.transactionType === 'credit') query = query.gt('amount', 0);
   if (filters.categoryId) query = query.eq('category_id', filters.categoryId);
   
   // Resolve bankAccountId to stripe_financial_account_id for filtering
   if (filters.bankAccountId) {
-    const { data: accountBalance } = await supabase
+    const { data: accountBalance, error } = await supabase
       .from('bank_account_balances')
       .select('stripe_financial_account_id')
       .eq('id', filters.bankAccountId)
+      .eq('connected_bank_id', 
+        supabase.from('connected_banks').select('id').eq('restaurant_id', restaurantId)
+      )
+      .single();
     
+    if (error) {
+      console.error('Failed to resolve bank account filter:', error.message);
+    }
+
     if (accountBalance?.stripe_financial_account_id) {
       query = query.eq('raw_data->>account', accountBalance.stripe_financial_account_id);
     }
   }
```

Update the call site:
```diff
-    query = await applyMetadataFilters(query, parsedFilters);
+    query = await applyMetadataFilters(query, parsedFilters, selectedRestaurant.restaurant_id);
```
</details>



> Committable suggestion skipped: line range outside the PR's diff.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In src/hooks/useBankTransactions.tsx around lines 135 to 156, the
bank_account_balances lookup swallows errors and doesn't filter by
restaurant_id; update applyMetadataFilters to accept a restaurantId parameter
from the caller, add an explicit .eq('restaurant_id', restaurantId) to the
supabase query, wrap the lookup in try/catch and log the error (or rethrow) so
failures are visible, and only apply the account filter to the main query when
the lookup returns a valid stripe_financial_account_id.
```

</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:medusa:ocelot -->

items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

**Accessibility concern: Disabling zoom affects the entire application.**

Setting `user-scalable=no` and `maximum-scale=1` prevents users with visual impairments from zooming, which violates WCAG 2.1 SC 1.4.4. While this makes sense for a locked-down kiosk, this meta tag applies globally to all pages including non-kiosk views.

Consider applying zoom restrictions only on the kiosk page via JavaScript or a separate HTML entry point for kiosk mode.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In index.html around line 5, the meta viewport currently forces user-scalable=no
and maximum-scale=1 which prevents zooming for all users; remove those
attributes from the global HTML and instead apply zoom restrictions only for
kiosk views by either creating a separate kiosk HTML entry point that includes
the restrictive meta tag or dynamically injecting/updating the viewport meta tag
via JavaScript when entering kiosk mode (e.g., add the meta with
user-scalable=no and maximum-scale=1 on kiosk entry and restore/remove it on
exit). Ensure the default/global index.html keeps an accessible viewport (no
user-scalable or maximum-scale attributes) so users can zoom when needed.
```

</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:medusa:ocelot -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment by CodeRabbit -->
notes: removed zoom restrictions from index.html, added dynamic viewport manipulation in KioskMode.tsx

_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

**Add aria-label attributes to inputs for accessibility compliance.**

Per coding guidelines, inputs should have `aria-label` attributes. Also, the placeholder "0.00" doesn't contain "cash" or "credit" keywords that the E2E tests rely on via `input[placeholder*="cash" i]`.

<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
              <Input
                id="cash-tips"
                type="number"
                step="0.01"
                min="0"
-               placeholder="0.00"
+               placeholder="Enter cash tips"
+               aria-label="Cash tips amount"
                className="pl-6"
                value={cashTips}
                onChange={(e) => setCashTips(e.target.value)}
                disabled={isSubmitting}
              />
```

```diff
              <Input
                id="credit-tips"
                type="number"
                step="0.01"
                min="0"
-               placeholder="0.00"
+               placeholder="Enter credit tips"
+               aria-label="Credit card tips amount"
                className="pl-6"
                value={creditTips}
                onChange={(e) => setCreditTips(e.target.value)}
                disabled={isSubmitting}
              />
```
</details>

items.title: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_
items.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_

**Critical bug: Missing argument and unit mismatch in `onImport` callback.**

Two issues here:
1. `handleContinueToReview()` is called without the required `amountCents` argument (see line 198-201 signature)
2. `setTipAmount(totalCents / 100)` converts to dollars, but `tipAmount` is used as cents throughout the component (e.g., line 171: `totalTipsCents = tipAmount || 0`)

This will cause incorrect tip calculations when importing employee-declared tips.


<details>
<summary>üîé Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
              onImport={(totalCents) => {
-               setTipAmount(totalCents / 100); // Convert cents to dollars for state
-               handleContinueToReview();
+               setTipAmount(totalCents); // Keep in cents to match tipAmount usage
+               handleContinueToReview(totalCents);
              }}
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In src/pages/Tips.tsx around lines 538-541, the onImport handler both drops the
required amountCents argument to handleContinueToReview and converts totalCents
to dollars while the component expects tipAmount in cents; fix by keeping
tipAmount in cents (use setTipAmount(totalCents) instead of dividing by 100) and
call handleContinueToReview(totalCents) so the function receives the expected
cents value (or alternatively convert consistently inside handleContinueToReview
if you prefer centralizing conversion).
```

</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:medusa:ocelot -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment by CodeRabbit -->
notes: npm test passed; npm run lint failing due pre-existing repo issues

+

{formatCurrencyFromCents(totalTipsCents)}

``` Also applies to line 113.
As per coding guidelines.
ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents ``` In src/components/tips/EmployeeDeclaredTips.tsx around lines 74 to 96, replace the hard-coded Tailwind color classes (border-blue-200, bg-blue-50/50, text-blue-600) with the project's semantic color tokens from the design system (use the appropriate semantic border, background and text token class names instead of literal color names), and apply the same replacement to the other occurrence at line 113; keep the existing layout and utility classes intact while only swapping color classes to their semantic equivalents. ```
notes: Replaced direct color classes (border-blue-200, bg-blue-50/50, text-blue-600) with semantic tokens (border-primary/20, bg-primary/5, text-primary). Tests pass.

**Add aria-label to icon-only delete button.**

The delete button at line 145-153 contains only an icon without visible text. Per coding guidelines, interactive components must have accessibility features, including ARIA labels for buttons without text.



<details>

```diff

                         variant="ghost"
                         size="sm"

                         disabled={isDeleting}

                       >

As per coding guidelines.
